body: You need to specify full path now. `cli` must be removed from `DataSourceOptions` (it was documented as a breaking change, but we forgot to remove it from the code). I'll submit a PR, and you need to remove `cli` from your side. Thanks for the report.

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.title: cli options not part of DataSourceOptions type

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
<!--
  Please follow the template.  If you don't, your issue may be closed.

  Have a question?  This is the TypeORM issue tracker - and not the right place
  for general support or questions.  Instead, check the "Support" Documentation
  on the best places to ask questions!

  https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/docs/support.md
-->

## Issue Description

### Expected Behavior

There is a clear way documented to set CLI options such as entity directory.

### Actual Behavior

All the documentation mentions adding this to the `DataSourceOptions`
```
cli: {
      "entitiesDir": "src/entity",
      "migrationsDir": "src/migration",
      "subscribersDir": "src/subscriber"
   }
```

But the type won't allow it

### My Environment

<!--
  Please add any other relevant dependencies to this table at the end.
  For example: Electron, React Native, or NestJS.
-->

| Dependency          | Version  |
| ---                 | ---      |
| Operating System    |  MacOS 12.3 |
| Node.js version     | 16.5.0  | <!-- run `node -v` to obtain this -->
| Typescript version  | 4.6.2  | <!-- run `npm list typescript` to obtain this -->
| TypeORM version     | 0.3.2  | <!-- run `npm list typeorm` to obtain this -->

### Are you willing to resolve this issue by submitting a Pull Request?

<!-- Put "‚úÖ" (:white_check_mark:) to one of these options, left "‚úñÔ∏è" (:heavy_multiplication_x:) others: -->

 - ‚úñÔ∏è Yes, I have the time, and I know how to start.
 - ‚úÖ Yes, I have the time, but I don't know how to start. I would need guidance.
 - ‚úñÔ∏è No, I don‚Äôt have the time, but I can support (using donations) development.
 - ‚úñÔ∏è No, I don‚Äôt have the time and I‚Äôm okay to wait for the community / maintainers to resolve this issue.


<!--
  Remember that first-time contributors are welcome! üôå
  üëã Have a great day and thank you for the bug report!
-->

body:
There is no -d option
You should add the full path:
yarn typeorm migration:create src/database/migrations/CreateCategories

> -d option is not working either

You should specify the file where you exported your data source object with the `-d` option and then specify your full path.
For example:
```bash
typeorm migration:generate -d <path_to_data_source>/datasource.ts <path_to_migrations_folder>/MigrationName.ts
```
would really appreciate if someone submit a PR with updates in the documentation.

> You need to specify full path now

what the hell? it's exhausting and not convenient at all. How to configure path once? you should've thought about it. And please update documentation, it's confusing.

Ok, if someone will be here with that question I created two scripts for package.json
```
"migration:create": "cd src/migrations && npx typeorm-ts-node-commonjs migration:create",
 "migration:generate": "cd src/migrations && npx typeorm-ts-node-commonjs migration:generate -d ../dataSourceConfig.ts",
```
so you don't have to write all that stuff everytime

> You need to specify full path now. cli must be removed from DataSourceOptions (it was documented as a breaking change, but we forgot to remove it from the code). I'll submit a PR, and you need to remove cli from your side. Thanks for the report.

@pleerock this breaking change is not a great direction. It completely breaks our workflows without a good workaround.

We use `.env` files for our configuration and generate the DataSourceOptions at runtime (we have many environments and pull keys from a secrets store).
It seems like you no longer allow using the `.env` for these variables and depend on an actual data-source file.

How can we work around this?

@pleerock absolutely ridiculous change
Why? This makes everything much more cumbersome.
